sub_topic: Identifying the perfect matching in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the graph shown below:

![Graph problem image](https://i.imgur.com/KScGu9v.png)

Determine if there exists a perfect matching for this graph. If there is a perfect matching, provide the edges that form it. If there is no perfect matching, explain why.
message_2:
There exists a perfect matching for this graph. A perfect matching is a set of edges such that every vertex in the graph is incident to exactly one edge in the matching.

The edges that form the perfect matching are:

1. (A, B)
2. (C, D)
3. (E, F)
4. (G, H)

Each vertex is connected to exactly one other vertex in this matching, and no vertex is left unconnected.
